data.title: Fantastc
data.text: We stopped by here and were given a friendly welcome by the young woman at the counter. Everything we ordered was fantastic! Fresh, well made, large portions and fair prices. In addition to the food, available to eat in or take out, they carry lots of unique middle eastern products and ingredients. We'll definitely come back when we're in the area!

data.title: A 911 emergency...no just great lunch
data.text: As I tried to find a parking spot I was struck by the number of police and rescue vehicles were there. I thought for sure there must have been a medical emergency, but I went in anyway!  Thank goodness because as I looked around no emergency was to be found just all these public servants having lunch!! I have been many times and can truly say have had a wonderful lunch at each visit. Everything is made fresh and with love, which is what happens when you have a staff and owner who put such care and attention into each order. The gyro is to die for, as well as the humus, cheeses, bread and other specialities. Great market with an array of spices you may not see elsewhere.

data.title: Great value for a great meal
data.text: I ordered and enjoyed the gyro plate. The salad was fresh and crisp. The rice pilaf was steamy hot and had a very nice balance of flavor. The gyro was everything it should have been.

data.title: Great Variety
data.text: Fabulous middle eastern food with cool market filled with unique products.Nice selection of sandwiches, love the Sonia's falafel, great lunch spot.

data.title: Consistently excellent!
data.text: Love..... the falafel chicken wrap, salads are huge, great tabouli, and wonderful desserts! Busy but has some parking. Nice area in the store for shopping to take home things to try. Some tables for eating there. Mostly seems to be take out. Everything is fresh and made to order. Really really good eats!

data.title: Best sandwiches
data.text: From the armenhammer to the supreme gyro, Sonia's has the best lunch time food around. They are super friendly and cater a large party platter in a pinch. The quality is top notch and the taste is impeccable. Tip: call in your order for lunch because they are ALWAYS busy with a line out the door at lunch time.

data.title: Excellent Chicken Gyro
data.text: The chicken gyro is excellent, the ingredients are very fresh and the chicken is cooked just right with just enough cucumber sauce. The staff and owners are very friendly and the sandwiches are always consistent.

data.title: Very good
data.text:
Friendly staff makes asking questions easy. 

We have tried salads, wraps and sandwiches. All were very good. Generous portions and high quality ingredients. I would like to try the "bowl" next time (falafel or chicken over rice with salad and yogurt sauce), we saw it and it looked very good. The house-made hummus is very good- creamy and delicious.

The market side has lots of different pantry items as well as refrigerated items at fair prices. There is a huge selection of spices.

data.title: Just ok
data.text: Went looking for falafels.  I had the Syrian Falafel wrap. The falafels were on the bland side and very crumbly. The pita was a bit chewy. The vegetables, sauce, and relish saved the day. Seven dollars for what is essentially a bean burrito is a bit steep.I will go back to try the babaganush (sic?) And the hummus. The staff is extremely pleasant. The halvah was divine. I say give it a try.

data.title: near East food with a flair
data.text:
lots of near eastern foods both fresh and canned.
this is a very nice small venue that takes and makes a lot of their own foods and pasty. they have shelves of many kinds of imported foods as welll.
you can eat in a small area and the food is really excellent. parking in front.

data.title: Really great near east-style sandwiches
data.text: The menu here is awesome. Lots of great and creative sandwiches that have a near east flair to them.

data.title: Sandwiches can't be beat!
data.text: Frequently enjoy sandwiches to go. Great selection and always a treat. We always have the chicken cutlet with grilled vegetable.

data.title: Their falalfels are delicious
data.text: This  is a small market selling  near east products. But, they also make wonderful sandwiches, salads, and prepared foods. I stop in to buy felafels and hummus to take home. Their felafels are delicious! I enjoy having them as a snack.

data.title: Go for the Triple Play
data.text: We had a fantastic sandwich there the other day called the triple play.  Ham, roast beef & turkey on crisp fresh bread with russian dressing.  It was amazing - would definitely go back.  The house made soup was good too plus the bottled drinks were ice cold... nice!  They had a large selection of specialty products as well.  Good Stop...

data.title: Can't get enough of this place
data.text: I go here once a week and I am NOT complaining!  I have tried most of their sandwiches and they are ALL great.  I keep coming back to the chicken falafel wrap.  It is dynamite!  I also tried the potato salad yesterday for the first time.  Needless to say I will be getting that next time.  They have a great location, great food, and a very friendly staff.  What more can you ask for!?

data.title: Awesome, the best
data.text: The quality of all the items I have had is very high, especially the staples of hummus, tabouli, pita, grape leaves, etc.  The sandwiches are excellent.  Great food, smiling and accommodating service, great prices.  It's the kind of place you want to return to every day if you could!

data.title: Love, love, love coming here for lunch and picking up specialty groceries
data.text:
Am I the first to write a review for this place? Yay! 

I have been coming here since the first week they opened and the food is just as great now as it was then. Everyone I bring here loves their salads and sandwiches, its hard to narrow down my favorite but I do love the eggplant sandwich and chicken falafel salad. If you live in RI come here for lunch and pick up a few spices, breads and deli items. If you are traveling through be sure to stop here for a bite to eat. During the summer I pack the picnic basket with goodies from here for the park or beach. 

Need tahini? Spices? Flat breads? Olives? Yogurts? Cheese? They have it all. I cannot say enough good things, this is one of my favorite places.
